outline verb [T]
(DRAW SHAPE)
to draw the main shape or edge of something: The area we're interested in is outlined in red on the map.
More examplesFewer examplesMichael Davis has prepared a memorandum outlining our need for an additional warehouse.The progress of religious reforms is outlined in a separate chapter.The scheme outlined in Mr Smith's speech has the support of the committee.The introduction outlines the content each chapter.She spent ten minutes outlining the main features of the scheme.
